Configure System HNG and NETCONF Settings

Use this task to configure HetNet Gateway (HNG) and Network Configuration Protocol (NETCONF) system settings on the PW EMS so that the PW EMS and HNG can communicate in order to pass configurations between them. The NETCONF protocol provides mechanisms to install, manipulate, and delete the configuration of network devices.

The HNG must be configured with the following parameters to have connectivity to the PW EMS:

  • The peer-endpoint IP address on the HNG is configured for the PW EMS.
  • The HNG operations, administration and management (OAM) core network interface (local endpoint) is configured with a floating IPv4 address. A floating IP address is used to make the on-premises network environment highly available.
  • The HNG must be able to send the Virtual eNodeB (VeNB) profile configuration for the support of LTE services to the PW EMS.
  • The PW EMS must be able to send Wi-Fi backhaul network profiles to the HNG.
  1. From the navigation bar, click Settings > System.
  2. In the System Settings window, click Het Net Gateway > REST and complete the following fields:

    Field

    Description
    IPv4 Address field

    Enter the floating IPv4 address of the HNG OAM interface.

    Port field

    Enter the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) port 80 or Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure(HTTPs) port 443.
  3. In the System Settings window, click Het Net Gateway > NetConf and complete the following fields:
    NOTE: For security considerations, any default user names or passwords belonging to devices must be changed on their respective devices.

    Field

    Description
    IPv4 Address field Enter the floating management NetConf Northbound interface for the HNG and PW EMS.
    User Name field

    Enter the administrator user who has access to the HNG device. The default HNG SSH user is admin.

    Password

    Enter administrator user password. The HNG default password is admin.
  4. Click Save.
Proceed to the Start the HNG to Activate the VeNB Configuration section.
Parent topic: HetNet Gateway
